headline: Paramount Stock Jumps After Earnings, as Warner Weighs Its Offer
summary: Shares in Paramount Skydance rallied about 10% after the entertainment and media company‚Äîwhich is pursuing a bid for rival media company Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äî reported earnings.  Revenue for the direct-to-consumer segment, which includes the Paramount+ streaming service, rose 10% in the fourth quarter.  Its TV segment was weaker, with Paramount flagging more difficulty ahead as pay-TV subscribers decline.

headline: Warner Bros says Paramount bid superior, countdown begins for Netflix response
summary: Feb 26 () - Warner Bros Discovery said Paramount's revised $31-a-share offer was superior to its existing deal with Netflix, giving the streaming giant four business days to respond or walk away from the bidding war for ‚Äåthe coveted Hollywood studio. The high-stakes battle could be in its final stretch after the announcement on Thursday.

content.title: Warner Bros says Paramount bid superior, countdown begins for Netflix response
content.summary: Feb 26 () - Warner Bros Discovery said Paramount's revised $31-a-share offer was superior to its existing deal with Netflix, giving the streaming giant four business days to respond or walk away from the bidding war for ‚Äåthe coveted Hollywood studio. The high-stakes battle could be in its final stretch after the announcement on Thursday.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery deems Paramount's takeover bid superior to Netflix deal
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has determined that Paramount‚Äôs latest takeover offer is better than the streaming and studio deal it struck with Netflix, marking a stark shift in momentum in the fight for the storied Hollywood giant.  The owner of HBO Max, DC Studios and popular titles like ‚ÄúHarry Potter‚Äù had previously backed Netflix‚Äôs proposal for months.  Netflix now has four business days to try and match Paramount‚Äôs proposal to further revise its offer ‚Äî which currently stands at $27.75 per share for Warner‚Äôs studio and streaming business.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors Determines Revised Proposal from Paramount Skydance Constitutes a "Company Superior Proposal"
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced that its Board of Directors (the "Board"), following consultation with its independent financial and legal advisors, has determined that the previously disclosed proposal from Paramount Skydance Corporation ("PSKY") (NASDAQ: PSKY) constitutes a "Company Superior Proposal" as defined in WBD's merger agreement with Netflix, Inc. ("Netflix") (NASDAQ: NFLX).

("Netflix") (NASDAQ: NFLX).

headline: Netflix Declines to Raise Offer for Warner Bros.

Discovery (WBD) that its Board of Directors has determined Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) latest proposal constitutes a "Superior Proposal" under the terms of WBD's existing merger agreement with Netflix. Netflix issued the following statement in response from co-CEOs Ted Sarandos and Greg Peters:

Netflix issued the following statement in response from co-CEOs Ted Sarandos and Greg Peters:

headline: Netflix Has 4 Days to Make a New Offer for Warner Bros. The Bidding War Continues.
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery  started the four-day clock running for  Netflix  to make it a new offer after saying it considers a competing offer by  Paramount Skydance  superior.  Warner Bros. said in a statement that it has notified Netflix of its determination that Paramount‚Äôs most recent proposal is a ‚ÄúCompany Superior Proposal.‚Äù  Under the terms of the Netflix merger agreement, this notice triggers a period of four business days during which Netflix has the right to propose revisions to its own merger agreement, the media company said.

headline: Warner Bros. Says Paramount's $111 Billion Deal Tops Netflix
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery said a new $111 billion offer from Paramount Skydance is a better deal for shareholders than the one it agreed to earlier with Netflix. Netflix will now have four business days to come up with a new proposal that beats Paramount or it will lose the fight for one of the industry's oldest film and TV studios. Paramount has offered $31 a share for all of Warner Bros. while Netflix has bid $27.75 a share for the company's studios and HBO business. Paramount Chief Executive Officer David Ellison has been pursuing Warner Bros. for months, efforts that prompted the parent of HBO and CNN to put itself up for sale in October. After Warner Bros. signed a deal in early December with Netflix, Paramount kept up the fight. Bloomberg News Senior Editor and Entertainment Team Leader Chris Palmeri joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.

content.title: Warner Bros. Says Paramount's $111 Billion Deal Tops Netflix

Netflix will now have four business days to come up with a new proposal that beats Paramount or it will lose the fight for one of the industry's oldest film and TV studios. Paramount has offered $31 a share for all of Warner Bros. while Netflix has bid $27.75 a share for the company's studios and HBO business. Paramount Chief Executive Officer¬†David Ellison¬†has been pursuing Warner Bros. for months, efforts that prompted the parent of HBO and CNN to put itself up for sale in October. After Warner Bros. signed a deal in early December with Netflix, Paramount kept up the fight. Bloomberg News Senior Editor and Entertainment Team Leader Chris Palmeri joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.

Netflix will now have four business days to come up with a new proposal that beats Paramount or it will lose the fight for one of the industry's oldest film and TV studios. Paramount has offered $31 a share for all of Warner Bros. while Netflix has bid $27.75 a share for the company's studios and HBO business. Paramount Chief Executive Officer David Ellison has been pursuing Warner Bros. for months, efforts that prompted the parent of HBO and CNN to put itself up for sale in October. After Warner Bros. signed a deal in early December with Netflix, Paramount kept up the fight. Bloomberg News Senior Editor and Entertainment Team Leader Chris Palmeri joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.

headline: Netflix Drops Warner Bros. Bid, Leaving Paramount the Winner
summary: ‚ÄúThe transaction we negotiated would have created shareholder value with a clear path to regulatory approval,‚Äù Netflix said Thursday in a statement.  ‚ÄúHowever, we‚Äôve always been disciplined, and at the price required to match Paramount Skydance‚Äôs latest offer, the deal is no longer financially attractive, so we are declining to match the Paramount Skydance bid.‚Äù  Netflix shares jumped as much as 13% in after-hours trading, indicating that investors were happy to see the company walk away from the deal.

headline: Netflix declines to raise its offer to buy Warner, says deal is 'no longer financially attractive'
summary: Netflix is declining to raise its offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äôs studio and streaming business, in a stunning move that effectively puts Paramount in a position to take over the fellow storied Hollywood giant.  On Thursday, after Warner‚Äôs board announced that Skydance-owned Paramount‚Äôs offer was superior to the agreement it had previously struck with Netflix, the streaming giant said the new price that would be required to buy Warner would make it a deal that is ‚Äúno longer financially attractive.‚Äù  Unlike Netflix‚Äôs bid, Paramount wants all of Warner‚Äôs operations, including networks like CNN and Discovery.

content.title: Netflix declines to raise its offer to buy Warner, says deal is 'no longer financially attractive'
content.summary: Netflix is declining to raise its offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äôs studio and streaming business, in a stunning move that effectively puts Paramount in a position to take over the fellow storied Hollywood giant.  On Thursday, after Warner‚Äôs board announced that Skydance-owned Paramount‚Äôs offer was superior to the agreement it had previously struck with Netflix, the streaming giant said the new price that would be required to buy Warner would make it a deal that is ‚Äúno longer financially attractive.‚Äù  Unlike Netflix‚Äôs bid, Paramount wants all of Warner‚Äôs operations, including networks like CNN and Discovery.

headline: Netflix backs away from its offer to buy Warner Bros
summary: Netflix on Thursday signaled it was backing away from its offer to buying Warner Bros ‚ÄåDiscovery's streaming and studio assets, saying the deal was no longer ‚Äåfinancially attractive after Paramount Skydance revised its offer for the coveted Hollywood studio to $31-a-share offer.  Shares of ‚ÄãNetflix rose around 10% in extended trading.  "We've always been disciplined, and at the price required to match Paramount Skydance's latest offer, the deal is no longer financially attractive, so we are declining to match the Paramount Skydance bid," Netflix said in ‚Äåa statement.

Shares of ‚ÄãNetflix rose around 10% in extended trading.  "We've always been disciplined, and at the price required to match Paramount Skydance's latest offer, the deal is no longer financially attractive, so we are declining to match the Paramount Skydance bid," Netflix said in ‚Äåa statement.

headline: Netflix walks away from Warner Bros deal, clearing the path for Paramount
summary: Netflix is walking away from its offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äôs studio and streaming business, in a stunning move that effectively puts Paramount in a position to take over its storied Hollywood rival.  On Thursday, after Warner‚Äôs board announced that Skydance-owned Paramount‚Äôs latest offer to buy the entire company for $31 per share was superior to the agreement it had previously struck with Netflix, the streaming giant quickly announced that it was declining to raise its proposal.  It said the new price it would have to pay to acquire Warner would make the deal ‚Äúno longer financially attractive.‚Äù

content.title: Netflix walks away from Warner Bros deal, clearing the path for Paramount
content.summary: Netflix is walking away from its offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äôs studio and streaming business, in a stunning move that effectively puts Paramount in a position to take over its storied Hollywood rival.  On Thursday, after Warner‚Äôs board announced that Skydance-owned Paramount‚Äôs latest offer to buy the entire company for $31 per share was superior to the agreement it had previously struck with Netflix, the streaming giant quickly announced that it was declining to raise its proposal.  It said the new price it would have to pay to acquire Warner would make the deal ‚Äúno longer financially attractive.‚Äù

headline: Netflix won't increase its offer for Warner Bros., ceding bidding war to Paramount
summary: Netflix said it would not submit a higher offer for Warner Bros.

headline: Paramount Skydance wins Warner Bros; Netflix walks away and its shares jump
summary: Paramount Skydance emerged as the likely winner in a months-long battle to acquire Warner Bros Discovery, after streaming giant Netflix on Thursday refused to raise its bid for the¬†storied Hollywood studio.  "We've always been disciplined, and at the price required to ‚Äåmatch Paramount Skydance's latest offer, the deal is no longer financially attractive, so we are declining to match the Paramount Skydance bid," Netflix said in a ‚Äåstatement.  Netflix confirmed to Reuters that it was walking away from bidding for Warner Bros Discovery.

Netflix confirmed to Reuters that it was walking away from bidding for Warner Bros Discovery.

headline: Why Paramount was determined to buy Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Warner's HBO Max and Discovery+ streaming division notched growth ‚Äî but not nearly enough to keep pace with the continued contraction of its traditional cable channels.
